dotProcessor.py

00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 import sys
00003 import os
00004 import errno
00005 import logging
00006 import tempfile
00007  
00008 # Pull in OS layer/class
00009 import osSpec
00010 
00011 ## Routines to run the external Graphviz 'dot' command and return
00012 # bitmaps, vector graphics, etc.
00013 # Uses osSpec to determine path to dot and optional arguments for same.
00014 # @file dotProcessor.py
00015 # @author Paul Hubbard 
00016 # @date 1/12/09
00017 
00018 ## Build a string suitable for execution via os.system
00019 def buildDotCmdDualFN(inputFilename, basename, outputType):
00020     
00021     outputFilename = '..' + os.sep + '..' + os.sep + 'inds-svg' + os.sep \
00022      + '%s.%s' % (basename, outputType)
00023     
00024     # Use osSpec to determine local configuration
00025     myOS = osSpec.osSpec()
00026     
00027     cmdStr = '%s %s -T%s %s -o %s' % (myOS.dotCmd, myOS.dotParams, \
00028     outputType, inputFilename, outputFilename)
00029 
00030     return cmdStr
00031     
00032 ## Assumes output directory same as input, input file is .dot
00033 def buildSimpleDotCmd(basename, outputType):
00034     inputFilename = basename + '.dot'
00035 
00036     return(buildDotCmdDualFN(inputFilename, basename, outputType))
00037     
00038 ## Run dot, check error code returned
00039 def runDotCmd(cmdStr):
00040     logging.debug('command string is "%s"' % cmdStr)
00041     return(os.system(cmdStr))
00042 
00043 ## Build filenames and exec
00044 def runDotDualFN(inputFilename, basename, outputType):
00045     cmdStr = buildDotCmdDualFN(inputFilename, basename, outputType)
00046     
00047     rc = runDotCmd(cmdStr)
00048     
00049     if rc != 0:
00050         logging.exception('Error invoking dot, exit %d' % rc)
00051     else:
00052         logging.info('Dot ran OK')
00053         
00054     return(rc)
00055 
00056 ## Save dot output to a named temporary file. Returns the full path to
00057 # the file, which is closed.
00058 def saveDot(dotString):
00059     mTmp = tempfile.mkstemp()
00060 
00061     # mTmp[0] is fd, [1] is filename string
00062     os.write(mTmp[0], dotString)
00063     os.close(mTmp[0])
00064 
00065     return(mTmp[1])
00066 
00067 ## Test harness     
00068 if __name__ == '__main__':      
00069     logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG, \
00070                         format='%(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(message)s')
00071     
00072     logging.debug("Here's what would be run:")
00073     logging.debug(buildDotCmdDualFN('foo', 'basename', 'svg'))
